alert.note: Alert for Brown; Clinton; Fayette; Highland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 7:08PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN BROWN, FAYETTE, SOUTHEASTERN CLINTON AND HIGHLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM EDT... At 708 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Sabina, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Washington Court House, Hillsboro, Greenfield, Sabina, Mount Sterling, Lynchburg, Leesburg, New Vienna, Jeffersonville, Marshall, Bloomingburg, Rocky Fork Point, Highland Holiday, Russell, Staunton, New Market, Good Hope, Martinsville, Fayetteville and Highland. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 62 and 76. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central, southwestern and west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
